premise: A man standing in a narrow alley posing for a picture.
hypothesis: A man is outside.
explanation_1: A narrow alley is located outside.

premise: Two young children are playing.
hypothesis: Children are playing.
explanation_1: Young children are children.

premise: Very colorful women at a party.
hypothesis: Woman are at a party.
explanation_1: There are both women at a party.

premise: A dog is jumping through the snow over some weeds.
hypothesis: There is a dog moving outside.
explanation_1: There is a dog jumping through snow outsides over some weeds.

premise: There are three men having a conversation at a social place.
hypothesis: The men are all talking to each other
explanation_1: "talking" is a rephrasing of " having a conversation".

premise: A man and a woman laying on red metal benches in front of a city skyline on a sunny day.
hypothesis: people are outside
explanation_1: People referred to man and woman.

premise: A man puts a helmet on his head.
hypothesis: A man is wearing a helmet
explanation_1: The man put on a helmet, therefore, he is wearing a helmet

premise: A woman, dressed in pink shorts and a bikini top, is leaping.
hypothesis: There is a woman leaping.
explanation_1: The woman is leaping regardless of what she's wearing.

premise: A crowd is gathered around a man watching a performance.
hypothesis: A group of people are watching an entertainer.
explanation_1: both people are watching

premise: A group of men playing a sport while carrying sticks on a field.
hypothesis: A group of men are outside on a field.
explanation_1: Carrying sticks on a field implies being outside.

premise: A woman sitting in the back of an SUV with food being prepared.
hypothesis: A woman is sitting in a car.
explanation_1: Woman and sitting are repeated, and an SUV is a type of car.

premise: A man in an orange vest works on fixing a train.
hypothesis: A man is outside.
explanation_1: A train is usually outside.

premise: A little boy is standing on the beach with a blue bucket and a green shovel while looking at the water.
hypothesis: A child is at the ocean.
explanation_1: A child is standing at the ocean with a blue bucket

premise: Two asian or spanish people, a woman and a man, sitting together in front of a glass window as cars pass.
hypothesis: Several people sit together as cars pass
explanation_1: "Several people" is a less descriptive way of phrasing "two asian or spanish people, and woman and a man"

premise: Three dogs run through a soggy field.
hypothesis: dogs running through field
explanation_1: The soggy field implies to that field the dogs are running through.

premise: A little girl in a white sweater with polka dots is playing with a wooden tracked train set.
hypothesis: A girl plays with some wooden toys.
explanation_1: girl is playing with a wooden tracked train set means girl plays with some wooden toys

premise: A man wearing sunglasses is sitting in a small vehicle.
hypothesis: man in vehicle
explanation_1: I think sentence 1 is in sentence 2's place here.

premise: Two young women posing for the camera.
hypothesis: The two women were showing their friends where they were at
explanation_1: Women do not have to be young.  Just because two young women posing for the camera it does not mean they were showing friends where they were at.

premise: Three boys are running on the beach playing a game.
hypothesis: The children are running away from a dog.
explanation_1: The fact boys are running on the beach does not necessarily mean they are running away from a dog.

premise: Child hanging decorations on a wooden fence.
hypothesis: The child is decoration his house.
explanation_1: Child hanging decorations on a wooden fence doesn't imply he is decorating his house

premise: A man is breakdancing in front of a crowd of people.
hypothesis: The man is a street performer.
explanation_1: He could just be having fun instead of being a street performer.

premise: A woman in a white v-neck shirt is enjoying a meal outside.
hypothesis: A woman is having a picnic.
explanation_1: Not all meals outside are considered having a picnic.

premise: A person wearing skis is also paragliding with a red parachute.
hypothesis: A person is paragliding over water.
explanation_1: paragliding doesn't always mean over water.

premise: A group of men wearing suits standing with other people sitting, standing, and riding a bike.
hypothesis: There are a group of men wearing suits for the event.
explanation_1: Wearing suits does not imply it is for any event.

premise: a man wearing a blue shirt and khaki pants is walking down the sidewalk.
hypothesis: The man is going to work.
explanation_1: Just because a man is wearing a blue shirt and khaki pants doesn't mean he is going to work.

premise: Two doberman's run through a field while one of them holds a tennis ball in its mouth.
hypothesis: The dogs are playing.
explanation_1: Dogs in a field would not necessarily be playing.

premise: A lady dressed in a beautiful pink, jewel encrusted outfit and makeup standing next to two children.
hypothesis: The lady is celebrating her sixteenth birthday.
explanation_1: Sentence 1 is missing celebrating birthday

premise: Two women with umbrellas walk between two cars as they cross the street.
hypothesis: They are out on an adventure.
explanation_1: The two women aren't necessarily on an adventure just because they walk between two cars as they cross the street.

premise: A blond woman stands behind a microphone.
hypothesis: A womans is on stage to sing for the audience.
explanation_1: Just because a woman is behind a microphone doesn't mean that she is going to sing.

premise: A young boy sitting is a field with a drain pipe in the background.
hypothesis: the boy is ten years old
explanation_1: The boy could be any age not necessarily ten

premise: Four older gentleman are outside sitting in chairs.
hypothesis: The men are at a cookout.
explanation_1: Just because the men are outside sitting in chairs, one can not assume they are at a cookout.

premise: A man sits underneath a large and colorful rock formation.
hypothesis: The man is out on  a hike.
explanation_1: The man is not necessarily on a hike, even though he is near a rock formation.  Note: There is an error with this one, if I highlight "hike" it gives me an error message.

premise: A young girl on an orange slide
hypothesis: A young boy playing.
explanation_1: A young girl on a orange slide doesn't mean that she's playing with the boy.

premise: A man is standing on top of a tall building that overlooks the city.
hypothesis: The man is in the middle of nowhere.
explanation_1: one man is in the city while the other man is in the middle of nowhere

premise: Three women are inside a bar are all holding drinks in their hands.
hypothesis: there is a group of people outside at a restaurant eating dinner and waving their napkins in the air
explanation_1: A bar and a restaurant are different places. Holding drinks and waving napkins are separate activities.

premise: A white dog jumping after a flying yellow ball.
hypothesis: The white dog is walking towards a ball on the field.
explanation_1: jumping and walking are not the same.

premise: A young women, that looks like a prostitute, is sitting on a bicycle.
hypothesis: The young woman is dancing in the street.
explanation_1: The woman cannot be sitting and dancing at the same time.

premise: A middle-aged man with long, curly red-hair wearing a dark vest, shirt and pants is holding a microphone in front of a black backdrop.
hypothesis: A man is dressed as the advertising character Mr. Clean.
explanation_1: A MR CLEAN AD IS NOT A BLACK BACKDROP

premise: Several men in hard hats walking along a snowy overlook.
hypothesis: The men are on a beach.
explanation_1: The man can be either walking on a snowy overlook or are at a beach.

premise: A man wearing a red, yellow, and green hat is bent over a saw.
hypothesis: A woman is eating dinner
explanation_1: Man is not woman

premise: A couple hugs as people walk buy at an outdoor event.
hypothesis: A couple fights loudly as onlookers observe.
explanation_1: A couple who hugs is not a couple who fights loudly simultaneously.

premise: A young boy walking across pipe over a body of water.
hypothesis: A young boy is skipping rocks on a pond.
explanation_1: Walking and skipping are separate actions.

premise: A picture of a woman in a shaded room doing her exercises.
hypothesis: The woman is doing water exercises.
explanation_1: You don't do water exercises in a room.

premise: two well dressed men standing together in field
hypothesis: Two men are sitting on a bench in the park.
explanation_1: You can't be sitting and standing at the same time.

premise: A young man in blue jeans performs a skateboard stunt.
hypothesis: A kid is playing a video game.
explanation_1: A man is not a kid (skateboard stunts could be in video games)

premise: A sheepdog is herding sheep down a grassy path.
hypothesis: A dog sleeps in the sun
explanation_1: The dog can't be herding sheep if it is sleeping in the sun.

premise: A group of people stand in a loose line on a brick ground.
hypothesis: There is a group of people sitting in a theater.
explanation_1: Stand in Brick ground - Sit in Theater - contradictory

premise: A man in a brown coat is wearing a helmet and riding a bicycle while carrying two plastic bags.
hypothesis: The man is driving his car.
explanation_1: Riding bicycle - Driving car - Contradictory
